metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Procedural programming is about writing procedures or methods that perform operations on the data, while object-oriented programming is about creating objects that contain both data and methods.
content.html: Procedural programming is about writing procedures or methods that perform operations on the data, while object-oriented programming is about creating objects that contain both data and methods.

content.text: Object-oriented programming has several advantages over procedural programming:
content.html: Object-oriented programming has several advantages over procedural programming:

content.text: Tip: The "Don't Repeat Yourself" (DRY) principle is about reducing the repetition of code. You should extract out the codes that are common for the application, and place them at a single place and reuse them instead of repeating it.
content.html: Tip: The "Don't Repeat Yourself" (DRY) principle is about reducing the repetition of code. You should extract out the codes that are common for the application, and place them at a single place and reuse them instead of repeating it.

content.text: Java - What are Classes and Objects?
Classes and objects are the two main aspects of object-oriented programming.
content.html: Classes and objects are the two main aspects of object-oriented programming.

content.text: Look at the following illustration to see the difference between class and objects:
content.html: Look at the following illustration to see the difference between class and objects:

content.text: So, a class is a template for objects, and an object is an instance of a class.
content.html: So, a class is a template for objects, and an object is an instance of a class.

content.text: When the individual objects are created, they inherit all the variables and methods from the class.
content.html: When the individual objects are created, they inherit all the variables and methods from the class.

content.text: You will learn much more about classes and objects in the next chapter.
content.html: You will learn much more about classes and objects in the next chapter.
